byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Sec of State John Kerry argues during talks in Vienna that United Nations Security Council should not be allowed to vote on lifting sanctions on Iran until after United States Congress has reviewed nuclear deal; argument is rejected by Iran, Russia and United States' European allies, complicating efforts by Kerry and Pres Obama to secure support for deal among Democrats.
lead_paragraph: The Security Council will hold a vote on potentially lifting sanctions against Iran, before Congress has a chance to debate the terms of the nuclear accord.

headline.main: U.N. Vote on Iran Nuclear Deal Irks Congress
headline.print_headline: U.N. Vote on Iran Deal Irks Congress

snippet: The Security Council will hold a vote on potentially lifting sanctions against Iran, before Congress has a chance to debate the terms of the nuclear accord.
